guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

author.bio: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.
author.bio_html: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.

body: If they're prepared to say that about creationism, I'd hope they're prepared to say that about evolution... Just because some dudes with lab coats say "hmmm I think God cannot possibly exist, I bet this all happened through magic" does not make that a correct, or even convincing, observation.
body_html: If they're prepared to say that about creationism, I'd hope they're prepared to say that about evolution... Just because some dudes with lab coats say "hmmm I think God cannot possibly exist, I bet this all happened through magic" does not make that a correct, or even convincing, observation.

author.bio: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.
author.bio_html: I am pretty moderate, I feel as though that's the easiest way to exercise common sense. I'm probably going to ask for evidence for your claims, or will be critical of baseless bullshit, but that doesn't mean I disagree with you.

body: Whatever way you want to look at it, something came from nothing. Calling it "science" and then jacking each other off does not make proponents of evolution any smarter than the proponents of creationism. Either something became nothing through "the undiscovered scientific principle," or something became nothing through "divine creation." That being said, it's not anyone's business to determine HOW God created the world, just that He did. Assuming He didn't because "that would be weird. It's like some sort of fantasy," is silly, since "weird" means nothing outside of what is created, and considering God is outside of what was created, there is no "weird" when it comes to the things He does.
body_html: Whatever way you want to look at it, something came from nothing. Calling it "science" and then jacking each other off does not make proponents of evolution any smarter than the proponents of creationism. Either something became nothing through "the undiscovered scientific principle," or something became nothing through "divine creation." That being said, it's not anyone's business to determine HOW God created the world, just that He did. Assuming He didn't because "that would be weird. It's like some sort of fantasy," is silly, since "weird" means nothing outside of what is created, and considering God is outside of what was created, there is no "weird" when it comes to the things He does.

body: Something coming from nothing requires more assumptions than something always having been there. Creationism is a more specific belief than simply believing in a creator, they think the earth is only a few thousand years old and anything that suggests otherwise is Satan's work. It's pretty ridiculous

He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
